title: Introduction of New Offences in NCL
narration: This presentation will provide an overview of the introduction of new offenses within the National Company Law Tribunal or NCL. We will explore the rationale behind these additions and their potential impact on corporate governance and compliance.

title: Rationale for New Offences
content:
Strengthening corporate governance.
Addressing emerging fraudulent activities.
Enhancing accountability of directors and officers.
image_desc: Business ethics, corporate governance. Type: illustration
narration: The introduction of new offenses in the NCL aims to strengthen corporate governance by addressing emerging fraudulent activities that were previously not explicitly covered. This enhancement also seeks to improve the accountability of directors and officers ensuring they act responsibly and ethically in their roles.

title: Key New Offences (Part I)
content:
**Financial Misreporting**
Inflating revenue or assets.
Understating liabilities.
False or misleading financial statements.
**Insider Trading**
Using confidential information for personal gain.
Tipping off others for illegal trading.
Trading based on unpublished price-sensitive information.
image_desc: Financial fraud, insider trading. Type: infographic
narration: Several key new offenses have been introduced including those related to financial misreporting. This covers actions such as inflating revenue or assets understating liabilities and creating false or misleading financial statements. Another significant area is insider trading which involves using confidential information for personal gain or tipping off others for illegal trading activities.

title: Key New Offences (Part II)
content:
**Data Breach and Misuse**
Unauthorized access to company data.
Misuse of sensitive information.
Failure to protect data privacy.
**Related Party Transactions**
Non-disclosure of related party transactions.
Unfair or prejudicial transactions.
Lack of transparency in dealings with related parties.
image_desc: Data security, related party transaction. Type: infographic
narration: Further new offenses address data breaches and misuse covering unauthorized access to company data misuse of sensitive information and failures to protect data privacy. Additionally offenses related to related party transactions have been introduced focusing on nondisclosure unfair or prejudicial transactions and a lack of transparency in dealings with related parties.
